actions.recommendation: Your BMI was slightly increased. This can be improved with nutritional adjustments (reducing sugar, increasing vegetable intake etc) as well as more regular exercise.

On your blood work, your PSA (a prostate screening marker) was normal. As you get older (>50 years old), it is important to screen for any prostate. This can be done with the blood screening marker and clinical examination.
No specific recommendations found for Women's Health.

Overall, there were a few areas that we flagged for improvement (including sleep quality, exercise, nutrition & maintaining a healthy weight). Making these lifestyle changes can be challenging, but so worth it in the long run. It helps prevent future chronic health issues.
As you get older (>50 years old), it is important to screen for any prostate. This can be done with the blood screening marker and clinical examination.
We can review in the New Year & repeat blood work for your Vitamin D levels.
We are here if you need any further support. And there are many other healthcare professionals that can assist you on your well-being journey.
